usefulItems: baking tray (30 x 40 cm), baking paper, piping bag with plain nozzle (1 cm), toothpick or wooden skewer, pastry brush, wire rack, piping bag with star nozzle (1 cm), refrigerator, oven
title: Smoked salmon and preserved lemon choux buns

ingredients.content: 1 ½ pieces preserved lemon, rind only, rinsed and chopped (approx. 1 tsp chopped)
50 g unsalted butter, chilled and cut into pieces (2 cm)
2 eggs, plus extra 1 egg lightly beaten, for brushing
100 g smoked salmon, cut into pieces (3 cm)

preparations.content: Place salmon, ricotta, preserved lemon, lemon juice, dill and pepper into mixing bowl and mix <b>20 sec/speed 6<b>, until soft. Transfer into a piping bag with a star nozzle (1 cm) and place into refrigerator to firm (approx. 1 hour).
Preheat oven to 190°C. Line a baking tray (30 x 40 cm) with baking paper and set aside.
Place butter and water into mixing bowl and heat <b>2-3 min/100°C/speed 1<b> or until butter melts.
Add flour and salt and mix <b>20 sec/speed 4<b>, until well incorporated. Set mixing bowl aside, remove lid and allow paste to cool (approx. 10-15 minutes).
Replace mixing bowl and mix <b>speed 5<b>, adding 1 egg at a time through hole in mixing bowl lid, until incorporated. Then mix <b>20 sec/speed 5<b>.

Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix <b>10 sec/speed 5<b>. Transfer into a separate piping bag with a plain nozzle (1 cm). Pipe small, walnut-sized balls onto prepared baking tray (approx. 12), leaving a 5 cm space between each ball. Brush each ball with beaten egg and sprinkle with nigella seeds. Bake for 12 minutes (190°C), then lower oven temperature to 160°C and bake for a further 10 minutes (160°C).
Turn off oven, remove buns from oven and pierce the bottom of each bun with a wooden skewer. Place buns back into oven to dry for 5 minutes. Transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
Once cooled, cut buns into halves and pipe reserved salmon filling onto bases. Top with a slice of smoked salmon and a little dill and secure top to serve.

hintsAndTricks: Choux buns can be made up to 2 days in advance and stored in an airtight sealable container. Fill just before serving.
